page.title: 12Superstitions Bathgate 2
page.content: Cairnpapple has a dome built over it with steps on one side leading up to an open hole at the top, leading into a burial chamber. There are many large stones in and around Cairnpapple. There are very large graves as well, about 3 metres by 1.5 metres. Cairnpapple is very high up, nearly as high as The Knock, which is the highest point in West Lothian. Most of the excavational work was done by Stuart Piggot. It gives you a creepy feeling going down into the grave and looking at where a body supposedly lies, under the ground. There are many strange stories as you can see, some of them could keep you up all night!
